sub_title: Head of Organisational Strengthening & Learning at Laudes Foundation

education.field_of_study: Ethnicity & Public Policy, Gender, Political Theory

profile_positions.description:
▪ Managed a 4.8-million-pound project with three distinct but integrated components: a multi-country research project led by the University of Birmingham; a youth entrepreneurship accelerator program in Gambia and Senegal; and a learning & dissemination program designed to capitalize on program learning and disseminate findings at multiple levels (global, regional, country and community)
▪ Developed the project concept and monitored the project budget and work-plan, managed staff recruitments and project procurement processes (including IP grant proposal review and contract negotiations)
▪ Established project coordination mechanisms to enable iterative program design, planning, and management within a matrix management structure and across remote teams (regional/country level)
▪ Facilitated workshops/trainings, conducted presentations and represented IOM to the donor (DFID) at key meetings
▪ Developed a learning & dissemination strategy with targeted, engaging and creative learning activities/products (community interactive theatre, community street art, West African inspired manga animation, audio-visual installation/photo exhibits, Massive Open Online Courses) as well as more traditional activities/products (internal learning workshops, policy events, practitioner handbooks, website content and 1 pagers)
▪ Established a cross-sector advisory group (composed of academics, technical advisors, program staff and the donor) to assure quality and oversight of research outputs
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
▪ Drove the research and learning agenda for the Information Management Unit by managing research activities, building research partnerships and leveraging internal and external expertise to support the use of data and contribute to organizational learning
▪ Coordinated a DFID funded six-country research project on various migration topics including: rural-urban migration, artisanal mining, youth migration, women and migration etc.
▪ Managed an EU funded 11 country needs assessment (prepared TORs, managed procurement, developed methodologies, managed consultants etc.)
▪ Provided technical support to the regional office in the development of learning activities and contributed to the design of concept notes and project proposals
profile_positions.title: Research & Learning Officer

profile_positions.location: Regional Bureau for Asia and the Pacific
profile_positions.description:
▪ Supported the roll-out of WFP’s newly launched global external evaluation system (DEQAS)
▪ Coordinated the concurrent delivery of three WFP external mid-term evaluations (funded by USDA McGovern Dole school-feeding program) in Laos, Nepal and Bangladesh
▪ Provided technical feedback on evaluation methodology, wrote TORs, reviewed and commented on sampling  and technical survey design documents
▪ Coordinated evaluation stakeholders and undertook the quality review of all evaluation deliverables
▪ Drafted a report for the regional office on lessons learned implementing external evaluations using the newly launched process
profile_positions.title: Evaluation Manager (consultancy)

company.name: African Institute for Mathematical Sciences- AIMS

profile_positions.description:
▪ Managed four departments (Logistics, Finance, Communications and IT) and monitored staff work plans and performance (10 staff)
▪ Oversaw a portfolio of grants and ensured compliance with all donor regulations and reporting requirements (annual budget of $2.2 M USD)
▪ Developed and managed the country program work plan and budget, reviewed and assessed financial progress in conjunction with project deliverables, prepared cash flow requests and ensured adherence to organizational procedures and processes
▪ Coordinated board meetings and managed the preparation of key financial and operational reports
▪ Managed the maintenance of the grounds and student and teacher residences (200+ students) and oversaw construction and renovation projects (including the construction of new student cafeteria/classrooms)
profile_positions.title: Executive Director Senegal (secondment)

company.name: Next Einstein Forum/African Institute for Mathematical Sciences

profile_positions.description:
▪ Part of the five-person team that launched the first-ever global science forum on the continent
▪ Supported the day-to-day operations of the NEF and ensured that project goals and objectives were successfully realized
▪ Managed project plans to meet budgetary expectations and timeline sensitivities
▪ Coordinated a diverse portfolio: financial management, project management, proposal and results framework generation and associated administration
▪ Supported project fundraising including prospect research, networking and exploratory meetings with high profile partners (Johnson & Johnson)
profile_positions.title: Logistics & Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
▪ Led the transformation of the West & Central Africa region to a new global Monitoring, Evaluation, Accountability & Learning (MEAL) model
▪ Advised 11 country offices in the region to effectively implement SCI's MEAL priorities and ensured that systems were in place to measure the organization’s global impact
▪ Launched an assessment of country office MEAL systems in the region and developed a regional MEAL strategy to strengthen these systems
▪ Led the development of a project management toolkit to effectively monitor project implementation in real time and capture data for decision-making and learning
▪ Supported the strategic planning process by facilitating strategic planning workshops and supporting country annual plan development
▪ Conducted MEAL training in country offices across the region (in English & French)
▪ Co-chaired the Tools & Systems sub-committee for the MEAL Community of Practice
profile_positions.title: Regional Monitoring, Evaluation, Accountability and Learning Manager

profile_positions.description:
▪ Responsible for the effective delivery of a $1M Social Innovation (SI) Program that connected entrepreneurs, startups, industry, academia and investors to develop projects and scale innovations to tackle social and environmental challenges
▪ Coordinated the SI program by managing the budget and contracts, creating program guidelines, developing EOI and proposal review processes, developing reporting requirements, tracking project milestones, reviewing financial reports and disbursing grant payments
▪ Built strategic partnerships with stakeholders in the innovation ecosystem to leverage cash and in-kind support for the program
▪ Planned and curated three partnership development forums in order to create a space for over 250 experts, academics, students, policy makers, private sector actors and non-profit leaders to develop cross-sector partnerships and nurture innovative solutions to social and environmental challenges
▪ Designed a Youth Social Entrepreneurship Program that incubated ten youth start-ups and provided entrepreneurship training and seed funding to develop and scale the businesses
▪ Researched trends and opportunities in the innovation space and documented the program implementation process to support learning and build internal expertise
▪ Assessed the results of the program and worked with Sametrica to utilize Social Return on Investment to measure impact
profile_positions.title: Program Manager, Social Innovation

company.name: Agency for Technical Cooperation and Development (ACTED)

profile_positions.description:
▪ Led over 60 needs assessments, impact evaluations and rapid assessments for projects with
budgets ranging from $75K - $5M USD
▪ Prepared TORs, designed surveys, developed questionnaires, reviewed training manuals and
survey field protocols, oversaw training and management of enumerators, provided oversight to survey field work, conducted data quality checks and prepared data sets
▪ Spearheaded innovative research and presented the results at UN cluster meetings and NGO
working groups to inform the programmatic direction of the humanitarian intervention
▪ Scaled and restructured the M&E department, developed internal systems, hired and trained staff (21 staff) conducted performance evaluations and facilitated training sessions
▪ Managed budgets for external evaluations, drafted work plans and terms of reference for staff and developed data collection tools
▪ Conducted research on best practices and recommended innovative approaches to improve
programming
profile_positions.title: Appraisal, Monitoring & Evaluation Manager (AME)

profile_positions.description:
▪ Conducted project monitoring missions and analyzed the relevance, efficiency, effectiveness, sustainability and impact of disaster-risk reduction (DRR) projects in rural Tajikistan
▪ Evaluated the content and methodology of community emergency response trainings and made recommendations to strengthen approaches
▪ Conducted research on current best practices and delivered recommendations to senior management
profile_positions.title: Monitoring & Evaluation Officer, AKFC International Development Management Fellow

profile_positions.description:
▪ Assisted in the strategic planning of communication and marketing campaigns Conceptualized new design and improved user-interface for the Faculty website
▪ Published web content, wrote press releases, reports, talking points, Q&As and speeches
▪ Networked with other academic departments and represented the Faculty at public events
profile_positions.title: Internal Communications Administrator
